alert.note: Alert for Routt (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 18 at 11:58PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM MDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Low basins in Hayden, and small stream flooding caused by snowmelt is occurring. * WHERE...A portion of northwest Colorado in Routt County along Hwy-40 between mile markers 106 and 109. * WHEN...Until 600 PM MDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas currently controlled by sandbagging. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1148 PM MDT, local law enforcement reported flooding in the advisory area. This is causing small stream flooding in and south of the town of Hayden. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Dry Creek to the Yampa River. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hayden. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
